claim: On Jan. 5, 2024, former U.S. President Donald Trump shared on his Truth Social account a video with the repeated words, "So God made Trump."
content:
The video was originally created by a group of Trump's supporters named the Dilley Meme Team and was later reposted to the former president's account.
In early January 2024, we received emails from readers who asked if it was true that former U.S. President Donald Trump had shared a video on his own Truth Social platform in which the phrase "So God made Trump" is repeatedly said.
The video featured what appeared to be an artificial-intelligence (AI) version of the voice of radio broadcaster Paul Harvey, who died in 2009 and was known for famously speaking the tagline, "Only now you know ... the rest of the story."
For example, one reader sent in the following email:
"God Made Trump" video with Paul Harvey posthumously narrating. Saw coverage first at CNN. Looks like an ad to make Trump look ridiculous, but apparently the intent was to support him. Trump shared it on Truth Social.
Another reader asked:
Can you tell us if the "God Made Trump" video posted on Truth Social is real or fake?
In answer to that question, yes, a "So God made Trump" video truly was shared on Trump's official Truth Social account. It was also true that the video featured an AI version of Harvey's voice and that it was discussed on TV on CNN, as the first reader mentioned.
Trump's Truth Social post was made on the morning of Jan. 5, 2024, just before the three-year anniversary of Jan. 6, 2021 – the day when the former president's own supporters rioted at the U.S. Capitol in Washington, D.C. and attempted to block the certification of the 2020 presidential election results.
Trump's post also appeared on @TrumpDailyPosts – an account on X that shares his Truth Social posts across platforms.
“GOD MADE TRUMP” pic.twitter.com/l03fK9SSfC
— Donald J. Trump Posts From His Truth Social (@TrumpDailyPosts) January 5, 2024

Additionally, the video was shared on X on Jan. 6 by both U.S. Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene and conservative activist Laura Loomer, among other prominent conservative users.
The video with Harvey's AI voice began, "And on June 14, 1946, God looked down on his planned paradise, and said, 'I need a caretaker.' So God gave us Trump."
The narration continued: "God said, 'I need somebody willing to get up before dawn, fix this country, work all day, fight the Marxists, eat supper, then go to the Oval Office and stay up past midnight at a meeting of the heads of state.' So God made Trump."
The video then featured spoken mentions of Trump purportedly fighting a "deep state," being "gentle enough to deliver his own grandchild" and able to "shape an ax but wield a sword," having "the courage to step foot in North Korea," working 112 hours in one week and taking on "the fake news" in "the den of vipers," among other moments.
The video was originally made by a group of the former president's supporters known as the Dilley Meme Team and was not an official creation of Trump's 2024 reelection campaign.
"Known as Trump's Online War Machine, our content generates millions and millions of views," the Dilley Meme Team's website reads. "Often shared by the man himself, and played at the rallies, we've been fighting fake narratives of the commies and fascists for years - BY ANY MEMES NECESSARY."
Congratulations to the Dilley Meme Team!
President Trump just shared this meme on his Truth Social account!
"So God made Trump"pic.twitter.com/OJ27ElQr5V
— Brenden Dilley (@WarlordDilley) January 5, 2024

"So God made Trump" (or simply "God Made Trump") was at least partially inspired by a real speech delivered by Harvey in 1978 for the Future Farmers of America convention. That speech was known as, "So God made a farmer."

original_rationales.main_rationale: In answer to that question, yes, a "So God made Trump" video truly was shared on Trump's official Truth Social account.
original_rationales.additional_rationale1: The video was originally made by a group of the former president's supporters known as the Dilley Meme Team and was not an official creation of Trump's 2024 reelection campaign.
original_rationales.additional_rationale2: The video featured what appeared to be an artificial-intelligence (AI) version of the voice of radio broadcaster Paul Harvey, who died in 2009 and was known for famously speaking the tagline, "Only now you know ... the rest of the story."

summary_rationales.synthesized_rationale: The 'True' rating is supported by the confirmation that former President Donald Trump did indeed share a video on his Truth Social account containing the repeated phrase 'So God made Trump.' The video featured an AI version of the late Paul Harvey's voice, known for the tagline 'the rest of the story.' Multiple readers reached out to fact-checkers inquiring about the authenticity of the video, which was subsequently verified. Furthermore, the content of the video aligns with Trump's rhetoric and actions, as well as being shared by prominent conservative figures. The origin of the video from Trump supporters, the similarities to a real speech by Paul Harvey, and its circulation among Trump's online platforms further solidify the 'True' rating.

detailed_reasons.reason1: The fact-checkers received emails from readers seeking clarification on the video shared by Trump on Truth Social, indicating public interest and prompting verification of the claim's authenticity.
detailed_reasons.reason2: The video contained the phrase 'So God made Trump' reiterated with an AI version of Paul Harvey's voice, linking the content directly to Trump and matching his messaging.
detailed_reasons.reason3: Prominent conservative figures like U.S. Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene and activist Laura Loomer shared the video, reinforcing its authenticity and alignment with Trump's support base.
detailed_reasons.reason4: The video's origins being attributed to the Dilley Meme Team, known for creating content supporting Trump, along with its connection to a real speech by Paul Harvey, provide additional evidence backing the claim's accuracy.
detailed_reasons.reason5: The video's distribution across Trump-associated platforms like @TrumpDailyPosts and its resemblance to Trump's known actions and statements further support the 'True' rating, indicating consistency with Trump's communication style.

evidence2: Can you tell us if the "God Made Trump" video posted on Truth Social is real or fake?

relationship_with_evidence.main_rationale, evidence1: The evidence directly supports the main rationale provided for the fact-checking, which confirms that a video with the words 'So God made Trump' was indeed shared on Trump's Truth Social account. The evidence aligns with the description of the video featuring an AI version of Paul Harvey's voice, the context of its creation by the Dilley Meme Team, and its subsequent sharing by Donald Trump on his social media platform. Therefore, the evidence is directly relevant to the main rationale that confirms the authenticity of the video shared by former President Trump.

relationship_with_evidence.main_rationale, evidence2: The evidence provided directly supports the main rationale. The claim states that a video with the repeated words 'So God made Trump' was shared on Trump's Truth Social account, and the evidence confirms the existence of this video, its content, and its distribution through multiple platforms, including the involvement of Trump's supporters like the Dilley Meme Team. The description of the AI voice of Paul Harvey in the video and the specific phrases mentioned in the video align closely with the details in the main rationale. Therefore, the evidence strongly supports the main rationale that the video was indeed shared on Trump's Truth Social account.

relationship_with_evidence.reason2, evidence2: The evidence directly supports reason2 from the fact-checking rationales. The article confirms that the 'God Made Trump' video shared by Donald Trump on his Truth Social account indeed contained the phrase 'So God made Trump' reiterated with an AI version of Paul Harvey's voice, linking the content directly to Trump and matching his messaging.

relationship_with_evidence.reason3, evidence3: The evidence 'GOD MADE TRUMP' aligns directly with rationale reason3, which states, 'Prominent conservative figures like U.S. Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene and activist Laura Loomer shared the video, reinforcing its authenticity and alignment with Trump's support base.' This direct connection between the evidence and reason3 is clear as it demonstrates the endorsement of the video by prominent conservative individuals.

relationship_with_evidence.additional_rationale1, evidence4: The evidence 'Congratulations to the Dilley Meme Team! President Trump just shared this meme on his Truth Social account! "So God made Trump"' directly aligns with the additional rationale that states 'The video was originally made by a group of the former president's supporters known as the Dilley Meme Team and was not an official creation of Trump's 2024 reelection campaign.' The evidence explicitly mentions the Dilley Meme Team, confirming their involvement in creating the video shared by President Trump.

relationship_with_evidence.reason4, evidence4: The evidence, which is a tweet congratulating the Dilley Meme Team for President Trump sharing the 'So God made Trump' video on his Truth Social account, directly supports reason4 from the fact-checking article. Reason4 states that the video's origins being attributed to the Dilley Meme Team, known for creating content supporting Trump, along with its connection to a real speech by Paul Harvey, provide additional evidence backing the claim's accuracy. The congratulatory tweet specifically mentions President Trump sharing the meme, thus corroborating the connection between the video and the Dilley Meme Team, as emphasized in reason4.
